https://www.linkedin.com/company/startup.text:
India‚Äôs quantum leap is officially underway. Bengaluru-based DPIIT recognised startup QpiAI has secured $32 Mn in Series A funding, co-led by the Indian government and Avataar Ventures.

Backed by the $750 Mn National Quantum Mission, QpiAI is building full-stack quantum computers and integrating AI for real-world applications in pharma, manufacturing, and finance.

Their 25-qubit QpiAI-Indus launched in April, with a 64-qubit system on the horizon. The company aims to manufacture hardware locally by 2026 and expand into the Middle East and Singapore. With profitability already in place, QpiAI is a bold step toward India's quantum-powered future.

Read more: http://bit.ly/44Az6GC

Partnership Announcement!
IKP EDEN, in collaboration with CEDAT & Let's UBX with the support of K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society, IT BT Department, Karnataka, introduces the BioXcelerate program under the WEscalate initiative. Designed exclusively for women entrepreneurs building DeepTech solutions in Biotech, Medtech and Cleantech. 

What does BioXcelerate offer?
Incubation
ÔÉº Product development, prototyping & regulatory guidance
ÔÉº Access to IKP‚Äôs lab infrastructure, equipment & expertise
ÔÉº Business & IP advisory
ÔÉº Personalized DeepTech mentorship

Acceleration
ÔÉº Go-to-market & pilot deployment support
ÔÉº Investor & industry connects
ÔÉº Fundraising and partnership enablement
ÔÉº Visibility through government and ecosystem platforms

Who should apply?
Women entrepreneurs or founding teams based in Karnataka working on science-driven, IP-led innovations in:
Biotech
Medtech
Cleantech 

Applications Open | Apply Now!!

Dr. Bindu Nishal recently participated in the multi-stakeholder dialogue on Systems-Based Interventions to Reverse AMR Dynamics hosted by Malla Reddy Vishwavidyapeeth.

The discussions focused on three critical themes:

üìä Surveillance & Data Systems for AMR
üåç Strengthening One Health Response to AMR
üíä Stewardship in Human & Animal Health Systems

Dr. Nishal and Dr. Sushmitha Sundar from Research and Innovation Circle of Hyderabad proposed the creation of a multi-stakeholder One Health consortium for Telangana. 

Her participation reinforced IKP‚Äôs commitment to enabling science-backed, system-level solutions that address global One Health challenges via collaborative innovations.

To partner with us in advancing One Health and AMR interventions, write to us at engage@ikpknowledgepark.com

üåü Congratulations to Deep Algorithms Solutions on raising ‚Çπ10.8 Cr (approx. $1.25M) in Seed Funding led by Unicorn India Ventures! üåü

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised ‚Çπ10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving ‚Äî Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

üí• More power to the team as they continue to innovate and protect the digital world!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/society.text:
SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) and Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay today hosted a thought-provoking brainstorming session on "Strengthening Investment Capabilities of Incubators."ü§ù

Key highlights of the sessions:
-Investment experience sharing by SIDBI-backed incubators.
-Building an investment offering at the University/Institutions level.
-Building a fund housed at the incubator
-Panel Discussion: How to build funds for success and attract capital?
-Incubating a collaborative platform to set up and support a university-housed VC fund in India.

Several insights and suggestions were shared by the speakers during the session. The highlight of the day was SIDBI's commitment to build investment capabilities at incubator level across India.

The deliberations sparked compelling ideas on establishing university-linked venture capital funds which can be¬†transformative for India‚Äôs innovation landscape and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Manoj Mittal | Sudatta Mandal | SATYA PRAKASH SINGH | Shaji Varghese | Anurag Singh| Dr Nikhil Agarwal | Tamaswati Ghosh | Kunal Upadhyay | Supriya Sharma | Sanea Vakaliya | Vipul Patel | Priyanka Agarwal Chopra |  Geeta Goel | Arumugam Aramvalarthanathan | Sandeep Nagbhushan Aithal | Prasad Shetty | Lakshminarayana Ponangi  | Punyatma Gupta 

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) | IITM Incubation Cell | Foundation for Innovation and Technology Transfer, IIT Delhi | Startup Incubation and Innovation Centre, IIT Kanpur (incubatoriitk) | IIMA Ventures | Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, India | ADB Ventures | Infosys

Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay is pleased to host¬†NCIIPC India (A unit of NTRO) and Startup India (DPIIT)¬†for an exclusive invite only¬†interaction on the¬†NCIIPC Startup India AI Grand Challenge 2025.

Based on the theme ‚ÄúResponsible AI for National Security‚Äù, the interactive session will offer valuable¬†insights into the challenge, its goals, and the exciting opportunities it presents for startups working at¬†the intersection of AI and national security priorities.

Key Focus Areas:

1. Code Vulnerability and Threat Detection¬†
2. Signal Processing
3. Domain Awareness
4. Geospatial Technologies
5. Cryptology and Forensics
6. Intelligent Document Understanding and RAG
¬†
Event Details:¬†
Date: 25th July

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/fittiit.text:
Big ideas. Bigger capital moves. 

FITT, Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi Delhi was thrilled to join a power-packed dialogue hosted by SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) at Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay  - reimagining how incubators fuel the next wave of venture capital. 

Our MD, Dr. Nikhil Agarwal, brought the heat, sharing FITT‚Äôs journey of turning incubation into investable innovation through smart data and bold strategy. He dropped sharp insights on:

üîπ The evolution of our flagship FITT Investment Fund and its role in enabling early-stage deep-tech ventures 

üîπ Strategic reflections on startup exits, equity structuring, and valuation-building 

üîπ Introduction of FITT‚Äôs proprietary DECIDE Tool designed to evaluate startup investment-readiness and comparability, now piloted with DSCE cohort startups 

üîπ A showcase of ecosystem-building initiatives like the FITT Angel Investor Network (FAIN) and the Faculty Innovation Grant Program, both aimed at unlocking institutional innovation and funding potential from within academia 

The session also brought together voices from SIDBI, Michael & Susan Dell Foundation, ADB Ventures, and Infosys Innovation Fund - all aligned on the mission to enable incubators to launch and manage sustainable venture capital funds in India. 

We thank SIDBI and SINE for convening this crucial dialogue and reaffirm FITT‚Äôs commitment to powering India's innovation economy by bridging deep tech incubation with catalytic capital.

Defence Tech Startups Demo Day ‚Äî A Resounding Success! 

On 17th July 2025, DSCE, FITT IIT Delhi, in collaboration with SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India), brought together India‚Äôs top innovators, investors, and strategic enablers for a transformative day of ideas and action in the heart of defence-tech.¬† 

Highlights of the Day: 

üîπ Welcome Address by Dr. Nikhil Agarwal, Managing Director of FITT IIT Delhi, who emphasized the growing role of academic-led innovation in catalyzing indigenous deep-tech development, and the accelerator‚Äôs commitment to nurturing high-impact defence startups. 

üîπ Keynote Address by Mr. SATYA PRAKASH SINGH , Chief General Manager at SIDBI, highlighted the growing impact of innovation-driven startups and cross-sector collaboration in reshaping India‚Äôs defence capabilities and advancing the vision of strategic independence in defence technology. 

üîπ Startup Showcase: 14 handpicked defence-tech and allied sector startups presented groundbreaking solutions 

üîπ Panel Discussion on ‚ÄúFuelling India‚Äôs Defence-Tech Ecosystem‚Äù offered a 360-degree perspective on building a robust pipeline of defence-ready startups: 

‚Ä¢	Angaee Gavand IDEX - DIO shared how iDEX is bridging gaps between startups and defence forces. 

‚Ä¢	Cdr Navneet Kaushik, Jamwant Ventures brought firsthand military experience to highlight mission-critical innovation needs. 

‚Ä¢	Addison Appu, ThinKuvate spoke on funding strategies and go-to-market readiness. 

‚Ä¢	Harshwardhan Saklecha¬† (ValleyNXT Ventures) shed light on scaling and investor preparedness in high-tech sectors. 

‚Ä¢	Moderator: Mr. Anagh Singh, representing MountTech Growth Fund - Kavachh, anchored the discussion with deep context and clarity on industry imperatives. 

Special thanks to Ankit Saxena, Director DSCE for hosting the Demoday! 

A big thank you to our ecosystem enablers, domain experts, and all participating founders who made this event a massive success! 

If you also want to be a part of such an ecosystem, DSCE next cohort applications are still open.

Apply now : https://lnkd.in/dNWNm5Zw

#NoHashtags #JustImpact

As India‚Äôs agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.¬† 

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India‚Äôs agricultural resilience.¬† 

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.¬† 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Wrapping Up: KVK Baramati's Agri-Innovation Insights!

Our Day 3 in Pune concluded on a high note with a visit to KVK Baramati! We were impressed by the new farming techniques brought in collaboration with international partners and how startups leverage KVK's farmer network for idea validation and reach.

Special thanks to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager, for the excellent guided tour.

This inspiring visit officially concludes our memorable Pune adventure, enriching our understanding of the region's vibrant startup landscape.

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneEcosystem #KVKBaramati #AgriInnovation #StartupSupport #RuralTech #DeshpandeStartups

Day 3: Exploring Innovation in Baramati at AIC - ADT Baramati Foundation!

Our deep dive into the Pune startup ecosystem continued on Day 3, taking us to Baramati for an insightful visit to the AIC-ADT Baramati Foundation! It was truly inspiring to understand the dynamic ecosystem thriving in a Tier 3 city.

A heartfelt thank you to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager; Sonali Saste, Incubation Manager; and Avinash Pudale, Technology Manager, for their valuable time and for sharing their work.

We gained key insights into their success, including:
‚Ä¢ A strong on-ground network with KVK Baramati, local industry partners like Baramati Agro Ltd, and their educational institutes.
‚Ä¢ A clear sector focus on agri and allied sectors, fostering organic collaborations and expertise.
‚Ä¢ International collaborations bringing global resources to the grassroots level.
‚Ä¢ A model of smaller cohort sizes for deeper connections and greater impact on startups.

This visit was a powerful testament to the distributed nature of innovation. Our exploration continues!

We‚Äôve set ourselves a goal, and we need your help to get there!

We‚Äôre raising funds for something close to our hearts: the NCL Technology and Entrepreneurship Club (NCL TEC) ‚Äî a student-led initiative by research scholars and associates at National Chemical Laboratory, Pune.

This club is where curious minds come together to explore ideas, solve real-world problems, and build technologies that can make a difference. It‚Äôs a space for learning, experimenting, and growing, and it‚Äôs entirely run by students!

To keep this spirit alive and thriving, we‚Äôre hoping to raise Rs. 10 lakhs this season. The income from this fund goes directly into supporting the club‚Äôs activities ‚Äî workshops, speaker sessions, early-stage prototyping, and more.

If you believe in empowering young innovators and supporting grassroots science and entrepreneurship, we‚Äôd love your help.

üîè Demystifying IPR for Robotics Innovators

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1 learning track, we organised an expert-led session on IPR and Innovation by Varunraj Limaye, Partner at K&S Partners.

With over 17 years of experience advising global enterprises on intellectual property strategy, Varunraj brought clarity to crucial topics such as patentability, IP lifecycle management, freedom-to-operate analysis, and protecting innovation across jurisdictions.

The Robotics cohort gained practical insights into how startups can build strong IP foundations early‚Äîenabling their technologies to remain defensible, scalable, and globally competitive.
